Parts.A:
Ah, adventurer. You have returned, albeit a too early. Come back another time...

((The fortune teller may tell your fortune every 4 hours))
Parts.N: Check if quest is on cooldown - if so, tell player to come back later.

Parts.A: Ah, an adventurer! Come to have your fortune read by the great Madame Curie, have you?
Parts.C: Oh, sorry. I was looking for that busty milkmaid.

Parts.A: Well then, not every fate promises fortune at the end. For some, there is simply just misery and death. A word of advice however - Knowing one's fortune or misfortune might severely impact your sanity. Do you still wish to proceed? If so, I will require five silver crowns for my services.
Parts.C: In that case, I best not delve too deep into such things...

Parts.A: I'm sorry dear, but being told one's fortune does not come free, especially when done so by the world renowned Madame Curie. Come back when you have the coin.

<Peers into the crystal ball on her table, studying it intensely as the white gas inside shifts and swirls within> 

Hm.... I see a curious being, covered in sand and rags. Some would call him a maniac who's lost his wits from the ever-ravaging harsh winds of the desert dunes. Others, more... "spiritually inclined" let's say, would perhaps call him wise or enlightened even. Seek him, and maybe, just maybe, you shall find your fortune.
Parts.B: Okay. Then I best be on my way, thank you.

Parts.A:
<Peers into the crystal ball on her table, studying it intensely as the white gas inside shifts and swirls within> 

Hm. I see a garden, in the midst of a lush, green jungle. Black lotuses grow all over the area. It is at the trunk of a great, old tree that you shall find your treasure. But jungles are full of peril... both large and small. Do make sure to bring mosquito repellant, at the very least.
Parts.B: Nothing I can't handle! Until next time.

Parts.A:
<Peers into the crystal ball on her table, studying it intensely as the white gas inside shifts and swirls within> 

Oh, adventurer... I see danger ahead of you, and possibly even death. Sweltering heat, a rotting corruption... aj aj aj. What you desire lies amidst ruins of a city once great, but now long forgotten and left to the unforgiving sands. Undead souls and gargantuous beasts of both claw and flame roam the lands. Seek out the red gargantuan, but tread carefully. You might find your fortune there, the only question is.... will you live to escape with it?
Parts.B: Thank you. Rest assured I will return with that treasure!

Parts.A:
<Peers into the crystal ball on her table, studying it intensely as the white gas inside shifts and swirls within> 

Oh... Interesting. The fortune you seek lies in a city of relic hunters. More specifically, in the quarters of a great woman of Shem. However, the crystal ball tells me she was possessed by an evil entity. If she still is, or if she has ridden herself of the curse, I do not know. Seek her out, and you shall find your treasure.
Parts.B: A great woman of Shem you say.... Thank you, madame Curie.

Parts.A:
<Peers into the crystal ball on her table, studying it intensely as the white gas inside shifts and swirls within> 

Hmm.... The treasure you seek will take you on a dangerous path up north. I see a great magnificent bridge, named after a deceit. It crosses the frozen waters below, and it is down there, at the northernmost pillar, that you will find your fortune. But perhaps bring a warm coat so you don't catch a cold! Or worse... frostbite.
Parts.B: <Nods> I'll bring a warm fur. Thank you madame Curie, until next time.

Parts.A: Jump block here so we can just jump to exit from all 5 options
